caption:
This photograph captures a moment during a parade or public event, featuring two men riding in an open, classic convertible car. The car is decorated with signs that read "CONG. RALPH H. METCALFE" and a phone number "324-3900", which suggests it is part of an election campaign or a civic event related to Congressman Ralph H. Metcalfe.

The man on the left wears a patterned, light-colored jacket over a dark shirt, waving at a crowd with his right hand. The man on the right, who appears to be Metcalfe, wears a white jacket and is also waving to the crowd with a very cheerful demeanor.

Around them, a diverse group of bystanders, including adults and children of various ages, watches and interacts with the procession. The crowd is casual, with some people standing and others seated; their expressions show interest and amusement.

The scene is set in a city street environment, featuring typical urban architecture of the time, with trees and residential buildings lining the street. The overall atmosphere is lively and festive, typical of a parade or public gathering.
title: Illinois Congressman ralph h.  Metcalfe (white coat) greeting constituents during the bud billiken day parade, one of the largest events for blacks in Chicago during the year.  The parade is held for blacks of all ages and economic status.  It includes black politicians, black businesses displaying their products, black bands and black beauties of all ages.  The route is through the south side down dr.  Martin l.  King jr.  Drive
